title: Paraguay - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group gathered in fron of the Presidential house and blocked Mariscal Lopez avenue to protest that some of the responsible people for the renegotiation of Annex C of Itaipu Binational company are allegedly against the interests of the Paraguayan people. The police was present. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), a group carried out a protest against President Mario Abdo, demanding him to provide answers about corruption cases and the government health expenditure during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the country received a USD 1.6 million credit to fight the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Itapua department (coded to Encarnacion), a group carried out a protest against President Mario Abdo, demanding him to provide answers about corruption cases and the government health expenditure during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the country received a USD 1.6 million credit to fight the coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, in Presidente Franco (Alto Parana), relatives of a lawyer who was killed gathered in front of the D. A. Office to demand a deep investigation of the case. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a large group gathered in Uruguay square and carried out a protest against President Mario Abdo, demanding him to provide answers about corruption cases and the government health expenditure during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the country received a USD 1.6 million credit to fight the coronavirus. Protesters also marched towards the National Republican Association - Colorado Party (ANR-PC), calling it a corrupt party. [size=a large group]

On 5 February 2021, in Ayolas (Misiones), security workers from Security Service Technology (SST) company that have been serving Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY), gathered in EBY's gates to demand the payment of their unpaid wages. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), kidney disease patients and their relatives protested and blocked the street in front of the Ministry of Health to demand supplies for their dialysis treatments. The group reported they have being facing this issue since last year. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), workers of the Social Security Institute (IPS) marched towards its headquarters to demand the Institute to review the budget cuts, to demand better working conditions, besides requesting the payment of a bonus for unhealthy conditions and exposure to the coronavirus. The police was present. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), Law students of the National University of Asuncion protested in front of the institution to demand the suspension of sanctions against a student for his double enrollment and the financial benefits he was receiving. [size=no report]
OTEP-SN: Organization of Education Workers of Paraguay National Union; Teachers (Paraguay); Labour Group (Paraguay)

On 3 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), teachers members of the Organization of Education Workers of Paraguay National Union (OTEP-SN) gathered in front of the Ministry of Education and Sciences (MEC) to criticize the Minister, since he did not consider their needs and demanded them to go back to work without providing the basic biosecurity supplies to protect them from coronavirus contagion. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group gathered in front of the Attorney General's Office to pressure the National Congress to remove the State Attorney General from her position. The group believed she did not properly investigate some corruption cases, besides having a close relationship with former President Horacio Cartes, who they believe to be a corrupt man. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in San Jose de los Arroyos (Caaguazu), residents of several neighbors that had been affected by the floods caused by the elevation of a ring road blocked km 104 of PY02 highway to demand solutions to this issue. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a march and motorcade were carried out by opposition parties, including the PLRA, and different organizations to celebrate 32 years of the Paraguayan's dictatorship end. They also demanded freedom for the Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA)'s President, who was arrested on 28 January on the charges of invoice falsification during the 2013 presidential elections. The group considered him a political prisoner. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Encarnacion (Itapua), a group carried out an anti-corruption march in front of the Palace of Justice, criticizing the Executive branch's influence on the Judicial branch. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), different groups, including supporters of the Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA)'s President who had been arrested on 28 January, gathered in front of the Attorney General's Office to pressure the National Congress to remove the State Attorney General from her position. The group believed she did not properly investigate some corruption cases, besides having a close relationship with former President Horacio Cartes, who they believe to be a corrupt man. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), parents of applicants to the Francisco Solano Lopez Military Academy (Academil) protested to demand more spots in the institution, since the nmber of available positions was reduced from 145 to only 90. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), for the second consecutive day, Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA) members blocked a lane of PY02 highway to demand freedom for the PLRA's President, who was arrested the previous day on charges of invoice falsification during the 2013 presidential election. The group considered him a political prisoner. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group gathered in the Presidential house to report that some of the responsible people for the renegotiation of Annex C of Itaipu Binational company are against the interests of the Paraguayan people. The police was present. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Villarrica (Guaira), a group protested to repudiate the nomination of a former Foreign Affairs Minister as the company's interim CEO. The group reported that both the new CEO and the President Mario Abdo were against the interests of the Paraguayan people. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), members of the Paraguay Pyahura Party (PPP) gathered in front of the Itapu Binational company's office to repudiate the nomination of a former Foreign Affairs Minister as the company's interim CEO. The group reported that both the new CEO and the President Mario Abdo were against the interests of the Paraguayan people. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), the president of the Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA) was preemptively arrested for falsification of invoices during the 2018's presidential election. He was a presidential candidate in that election. PLRA members considered him a political prisoner, blaming the President Mario Abdo, former President Horacio Cartes and the State Attorney General of conspiracy. The PLRA is one of the main parties of the country.

On 28 January 2021, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA) members protested to demand the release of the PLRA's President, who was arrested on the same day on charges of invoice falsification during the 2013 presidential election. The group considered him a political prisoner. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group gathered in front of the headquarters of the Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA) to protest and repudiate the prison order against the PLRA's President, who was facing a judicial process for alleged falsification of invoices. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Encarnacion (Itapua), workers from the local branch of Banco Rio gathered in front of the bank to protest for the preservation of their job positions, since a dismissal procedure was going on due to reduction of tasks. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group of small farmers from the area of Marina Cue in Curuguaty gathered in Armas square to demand the Congress to ratify the transfer of the lands they have been occupying for themselves. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), transportation workers protested to demand the Asuncion Bus Terminal (TOA) to extend the fee's exemption. This exemption was implemented last year due to the economic crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), ship workers gathered in front of the headquarters of the Ministry of Labor, Employment and Social Security (MTESS) to report violation of their labor rights by 17 companies and to demand the payment of their Christmas bonus, vacations, among other demands. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Luque (Central), informal airport porters protested in front of Silvio Pettirossi Airport to demand a meeting with the National Directorate of Civil Aeronautics (Dinac) after they forbade their presence at the airport terminal. The group demanded their right to work there again. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), drivers of private transportation apps protested in front of the National Police Command to repudiate a robbery attempt which led to a bullet injury in one of their co-workers. The police promised to pay for all the victim's medical expenses. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), seven dismissed workers of City Market company gathered in the Palace of Justice and carried out a protest and hunger strike to repudiate the justice's decision to not seize the assets of their employers. The protesters were requesting the seizures as means to assure the payment of their unpaid wages and bonuses. A group of auctioneers protested in the same place to demand the end of a co-worker's suspension, who is currently the President of the Paraguayan Association of Auctioneers. [size=seven]

Around 24 January 2021, around San Alfredo municipality (Concepcion), residents who live nearby the river blocked km 130 of PY22 highway to protest against the Presidential decision to veto Law No. 4716 that would create districts in San Alfredo area. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), Health Council officials from different parts of the country protested in front of the Ministry of Health to demand their hiring by the institution, complying with a law that aims to remove local health staff from precarious positions. This way, they would have better salaries and benefits and would be employees of the Ministry, instead of local councils. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), dozens of dismissed workers of City Market company gathered in the Palace of Justice to repudiate the justice's decision to not seize the assets of their employers. The protesters were requesting the seizures as means to assure the payment of their unpaid wages and bonuses. [size=dozens]

On 20 January 2021, in Capiata (Central), residents of Kennedy neighborhood marched to demand repair works in the streets' area. Some other residents reported the protest was promoted by a politician, focusing on the municipal elections. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Encarnacion (Itapua), employees and owners of commercial establishments marched through the city and set up a vigil in the access to the international bridge to wait for the Senate to approve an economic subsidy bill for the sector overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Paraguari (Paraguari), residents of the city center, La Negrita I, Fraccion Las Palmeras and San Blas Loma neighborhoods intermittently blocked km 65 of PY01 highway to complain about the lack of water provision in the area. Later, the group marched towards the City Hall. [size=no report]

Around 20 January 2021 (week of), in Encarnacion (Itapua), workers from the local branch of Banco Rio gathered in front of the bank to protest for the preservation of their job positions, since a dismissal procedure was going on due to reduction of tasks. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), students of the National University of Asuncion gathered in front of the Presidential residence to demand a new regulatory decree of the zero fee law, in order to annul three controversial points. The zero fee law aimed to eradicate public universities's fee for all students. [size=no report]
San Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz
San Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz

Around 17 January 2021, in San Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz (Paraguari), residents carried out a motorcade to demand the return of the institutional peace in the city, considering the intense disputes between City Councilors and the Mayor. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2021, in Ypacarai (Central), around 300 people carried out a motorcade and intermittently blocked a toll on PY02 highway to demand free pass for residents, since the toll divided neighborhoods and residents have to cross it all the time. [size=around 300]

Around 15 January 2021 (as reported), in Asuncion (Asuncion), the Self-Convened Citizens Public Exposure Commission (CACE) gathered in the headquarters of the judicial branch and protested against the son of an ANR's Congressman, who along with his father was accused of illicit enrichment. He tried to attack and take the phone of one of the protesters. [size=no report]

Around 13 January 2021, in Curuguaty (Canindeyu), small farmers of the area blocked a road to protest against the Presidential decision to veto the transfer of lands known as Marina Cue in their favor. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Luque (Central), informal airport porters protested in front of Silvio Pettirossi Airport to demand a meeting with the National Directorate of Civil Aeronautics (Dinac) after they forbade their presence at the airport terminal. The group demanded a financial compensation for the end of their activities. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), soccer players who belong to clubs from the lower divisions of the Paraguayan Football Association (APF) tournaments blocked Silvio Pettirossi Avenue, in front of the Ministry of Health, to demand the approval of a protocol that would allow sport events to be held without the need to present a negative coronavirus exam result. They claimed they were being affected by the suspension of tournaments due to the pandemic. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group carried out a vigil in the Justice Palace to demand justice and a sentence during a former Senator's trial for money laundering and other crimes. [size=no report]

Around 11 January 2021, in Coronel Oviedo (Caaguazu), residents of Potrero Cue neighborhood carried out a vigil and a protest against the works of duplication and the creation of ring road on Route PY02. They claimed it will isolate them and they would have to drive more to reach some establishments. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in San Juan Bautista (Misiones), almost 40 construction day laborers protested against the municipal government's decision to reduce their weekly five-day work schedule for three days only. The group complained that this would affect their incomes and therefore they would have difficulty in providing for their families. [size=almost 40]

On 11 January 2021, in Villa Florida (Misiones), around 50 fishermen blocked PY01 road on the bridge over the Tebicuary River to demand to the Minister of the Environment and Sustainable Development to intervene in the use of the river's water in the pumping systems to the rice plantation. The group claimed that because of this the river was no longer navigable and they could not work. [size=around 50]

On 11 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), members of the Circle of Retired Officials of the Highway Patrol protested in front of the Ministry of Public Works and Communications to demand the compliance with the article 103 of the Constitution, which equates their wages with active workers', among other demands. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Encarnacion (Itapua), workers from the local branch of Banco Rio gathered in front of the bank to protest for the preservation of their job positions, since a dismissal procedure was going on due to reduction of tasks. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group took a coffin to the front of the Justice Palace to demand 'death to corruption', protesting in demand of a sentence to a former Senator in his trial for money laundering and other crimes. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), a group of rural workers of the Toryvete neighborhood of Hernandarias district blocked Alejo Garcia Avenue to demand a judicial measure in a property, where there was an eviction on 7 October 2020. The group have been demanding to the National Institute of Rural and Land Development (Indert) the possession of lands that were being used by foreign producers. [size=no report]
On 8 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), health workers of Itapua department protested to demand the payment of their unpaid wages. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in San Antonio (Central), for the second consecutive day, a group gathered in front of the City Hall to protest in demand of the PLRA Mayor's resignation, who was being accused of embezzlement and other related crimes. A woman also chained herself to a utility pole as means of protest. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in San Juan Bautista (Misiones), relatives and friends of two Paraguayan women who were found dead in Ezeiza-Canuelas highway in Argentina protested in Boqueron square to demand justice and clarification on the case. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in San Antonio (Central), a group of citizens set up a tent in front of the City Hall to protest in demand of the PLRA Mayor's resignation, who was being accused of embezzlement and other related crimes. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in Villarrica (Guaira), for the second consecutive day, relatives and neighbors of a child who died after being ran over by a drunk driver gathered in front of the D. A. Office to demand the change of the driver's imputation of wrongful death to intentional homicide. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Coronel Oviedo (Caaguazu), around 50 Mbya Guarani indigenous people blocked the avenues adjacent to the house of the President of the Paraguayan Institute of the Indigenous (Indi) to demand the purchase of lands for them. [size=around 50]

On 6 January 2021, in Villarrica (Guaira), relatives and neighbors of a child who died after being ran over by a drunk driver, gathered in front of the D. A. Office to demand the change of the driver's imputation of wrongful death to intentional homicide. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), dozens of doctors gathered in front of the Central Hospital of the Social Security Institute (IPS) to complain about the layoff of around 60 health workers, which they claimed that it was a retaliation for the protests in demand for better working conditions. The group demanded the renewal of contracts for 2021 and announced they would go on a strike. [size=dozens]

On 5 January 2021, in the rural area of Ypane (Central), residents of the settlement 1 de Marzo of Thompson neighborhood protested in front of the local justice of the peace, in defense of a social leader, who was prosecuted for domestic violence. [size=no report]

On 30 December 2020, in Caaguazu (Caaguazu), around 40 Mbya Guarani indigenous people blocked km 178 of PY02 highway to demand food assistance and transportation to their communities. [size=around 40]

On 30 December 2020, in San Antonio (Central), residents protested against the PLRA Mayor, who was leading people from other locations to register in the district to vote there. It was also reported that an armed group was around to protect the Mayor and intimidate his opponents. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, in the rural area of Itaugua (Central), residents of the Vecinos Unidos settlement in Aldama Canada area protested in front of the PLRA Mayor's house to demand the revocation of the resolution that recognized another neighborhood commission. The recognition of two commissions for the same area violates the municipal regulation. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, in the rural area of Tembiapora (Caaguazu), members of FNC (National Peasants Federation) protested in the lands they have been occupying in Guahory area, to demand that the State purchases the land and distribute it to 100 families that have been living there. The demand took place under a land dispute that involved the State, FNC and the land owners. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, around Curuguaty municipality (Canindeyu), indigenous people from several parts of the department blocked the traffic on a road between Curuguaty and Villa Ygatimi to repudiate and demand the dismissal of the Director of the Canindeyu Agricultural Development Center (CDA) for mistreatment of employees who work in indigenous communities. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, in San Lorenzo (Central), Watson S.A company's workers gathered in front of the city's court to protest in demand of the company's executives conviction for fraud, since they did not pay the IPS (Institute of Social Security), and therefore the employees will not be able to retire. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), residents of Jesus de Tavarangue municipality gathered in front of the D. A. Office to demonstrate in demand of greater agility in the investigation into the mayor, who is being accused of breach of trust. The demonstrators threw eggs and stones at the car of the city's legal advisor and at the police's car, which was transporting him. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group marched against corruption from the Attorney General's Office, passing in the Ministry of the Interior towards the Pantheon of Heroes. The group set up a Christmas tree with 133 pictures of authorities they consider to be corrupt. The figure at the top of the tree was the State Attorney General, who they believe did not properly investigate some corruption cases. [size=no report]

Around 22 December 2020, in Dr. J. Eulogio Estigarribia (Caaguazu), a group of indigenous people from San Juan Yhjovy community intermittently blocked PY02 highway to demand direct vote in the election of their leaders to the Paraguayan Institute of the Indigenous People (Indi). The group claimed that Indi have been unilaterally nominating representatives for these positions. [size=no report]

Around 21 December 2020 (as reported), in Villarrica (Guaira), residents from the surroundings of the II Infantry Division attacked with stones and sticks the personnel of LMJ S.A., who had began the cleaning work in order to divide the property. The residents are against a real estate development in the area, and they claimed that there is a law that allocates part of the land as their communal fields. The workers escaped from the location. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), an important amount of Clinic Hospital's health workers gathered in front of the Ministry of Health to report the non-payment of the second bonus for the coronavirus pandemic and the lack of supplies, which led them to buy those themselves. [size=an important amount]

On 21 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), merchants gathered near the international bridge and set fire to Christmas trees to demonstrate against the government's lack of response towards the economic reactivation of the city and the payment of a subsidy. The event happened during the coronavirus pandemic and the Paraguay-Argentina border's closure, which resulted in an economic crisis in bordering cities. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the nineteenth day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. Later, the group decided to temporarily suspend the blockade and let cargo vehicles cross the border with Argentina. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), residents of San Pedro neighborhood protested after receiving a notification from the Yacyreta Binational Entity (EBY) that only 50 families of the 240 registered will receive vouchers to buy food for the holidays. [size=no report]
Government of Paraguay (2013-); CN: National Crusade

On 18 December 2020, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), a group, joined by a CN (National Crusade) Congressman, burned face masks in a demonstration against its use during the coronavirus pandemic. The Congressman leads a movement against masks and presented a bill to turn its use optional, besides claiming it is unhealthy. [size=no report]
ANR-PC: National Republican Association - Colorado Party

On 18 December 2020, in Repatriacion (Caaguazu), residents and indigenous people gathered around the City Hall and demonstrated against the alleged irregularities in the ANR Mayor's administration and demand greater transparency. A group who supports the Mayor counter-demonstrated and there was a clash between the groups, which resulted in some injuries. The police intervened and were able to control the situation after using tear gas. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2020, around San Alfredo municipality (Concepcion), landless farmers of Puerto Fonciere and San Alfredo intermittently blocked Route PY22 (km 137) to demand the Yambay (Propafisa)'s lands to be measured again, due to their belief that there were 4,000 hectares of surplus. [size=no report]

On 18 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), merchants of the Asuncion Bus Terminal (TOA) blocked half of a street in a protest against the government's announcement of restrictions on travelling to the countryside during the holidays, due to the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the eighteenth day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. Cargo vehicles drivers, who have been prevented to cross the border due to ANNP's blockade, counter-protested by blocking the international road and an avenue to demand the reopening of ANNP. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, in Luque (Central), a group of applicants from the Higher Institute of Police Education (Isepol) protested against the modification of the admission regulations, which implied that the result of the psychotechnical exam would not exclude those who failed. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, in Repatriacion (Caaguazu), more than six residents and indigenous people tried to occupy the City Hall as means of protests against the alleged irregularities in the ANR Mayor's administration and demand greater transparency. The police intervened to guarantee the access to the municipal workers. The police cleared the entrance, and they pushed some of the demonstrators. [size=more than six]

On 16 December 2020, in Puerto Casado (Alto Paraguay), users of the Paraguayan Sanitary Services Company (Essap) protested to demand a fixed rate for all users, since they have received invoices with different prices. Besides that, the group claimed that most of them could not pay the bill due to the lack of work. [size=no report]

Around 16 December 2020 (week of), in Luque (Central), associates of the Luque Cooperative protested to demand the results of the inspection carried out by the National Institute of Cooperatives (Incoop), after the alleged irregular granting of credits to the entity's directors. The group was trying to avoid that the reported case would end without sanctions. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), taxi drivers blocked several streets and avenues, besides PY06 and PY01 roads to demand social assistance and food bags. For the seventeenth consecutive day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, in Caaguazu (Caaguazu), around 20 FNC (National Peasants Federation) members protested in front of the D. A. Office to report fiscal persecution after the imputation of 50 farmers for invading properties in Colonia Guahory. [size=around 20]

On 15 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), residents, farmers and the Mbaracayu's Mayor gathered in the Ministry of Economy to demand the construction of a paved road that crosses the city, besides complaining about years of negligence by the national authorities. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), members of the Paraguayan Federation of Patients with Rare Diseases (Fepper) protested in front of the Ministry of Public Health to demand support for children who suffer from rare pathologies. They claimed that parents must pay for expensive treatments because the state does not cover it. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the sixteenth day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, in Repatriacion (Caaguazu), for the second consecutive day, a group of citizens chained themselves in the City Hall to report alleged irregularities in the ANR Mayor's administration and demand greater transparency. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, in Puerto Indio (Alto Parana), residents, the Mbaracayu's Mayor and City Councilors blocked the street that has access to Puerto Indio as means of protest to demand pavement in the area. The group dug a hole in the street, so that no cargo trucks could pass, resulting in a line of approximately 50 trucks. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the fifteenth consecutive day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. The group also marched through the city demanding exemption of electricity and water bills, the freezing of their debts, among others. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, in San Pedro de Ycuamandiyu (San Pedro), members of PPP (Paraguay Pyahura Party) protested around the Justice Palace during the trial of one of its activists for a 2016 EPP (Paraguayan People's Army) kidnapping, to support him and claim he is innocent. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, in Repatriacion (Caaguazu), a group of citizens chained themselves in the City Hall to report alleged irregularities in the ANR Mayor's administration and demand greater transparency. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2020, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), a group of ''pro-life'' and ''pro-family'' activists carried out a motorcade to demand the resignation of the Childhood's Ministry and to repudiate the attempt to include diversity in the National Plan for Children and Teenagers, in order to eliminate prejudice. The group claimed it would confuse children about their identity. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the fourteenth consecutive day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2020, in Carapegua (Paraguari), a group carried out a motorcade to support the parents of a girl affected by spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) and their demand to President Mario Abdo for money for her treatment. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), numerous people gathered in the Ministry of Health to support the parents of a girl affected by spinal muscular atrophy (SMA), who were chained to the building and demanding to President Mario Abdo for money for her treatment. [size=numerous]

On 12 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the thirteenth consecutive day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a group protested in the Ministry of Health against the President of the National Bioethics Commission (Conabepy), who was responsible for the medical report that indicated that a girl affected by spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) was not eligible to receive Zolgesma medication. Protesters called her a ''murderer'', while her parents chained themselves to the building and only left after the Minister of Health promised to solve this issue. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, in Juan Augusto Saldivar (Central), parents of students of Padre Antonio Terstiegue school protested in front of the City Hall to demand the delivery of food kits in replace of school lunches, since classes have been suspended due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group also complained about the quality and amount of products in those kits. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, in Luque (Central), applicants to the Gral. Jose Eduvigis Diaz Police Academy requested the annulment of the admission exam due to a case of corruption, since one of the institution's employees were charging PYG 27,000,000 to guarantee vacancies. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, in Encarnacion (Itapua), for the twelfth consecutive day, merchants blocked the access to the National Navigation and Ports Administration (ANNP) to demand an answer from the government towards the economy's reactivation and the payment of a subsidy to overcome the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
CCT: Confederation of the Working Class; Labour Group (Paraguay)

On 10 December 2020, in Asuncion (Asuncion), several organizations, including CCT (Confederation of the Working Class), gathered in Pantheon of Heroes, under the context of the Human Rights Day, to repudiate the last dictatorship in the country, support individual and collective rights, besides demanding the State to provide land, health, education, food and work for the underprivileged citizens. Protesters also criticized Mario Abdo's government. [size=no report]

On 11 June 2020, in the rural area of Loreto (Concepcion), there was a shoot-out between ACA (Armed Peasant Association) and the Joint Task Force, which led to the death of an ACA's leader. The victim was accused of kidnapping and other crimes. 1 fatality

On 10 June 2020, in Ciudad del Este (Alto Parana), 23 people who were complying with the quarantine in a shed in Mercosur Park set fire to a mattress because it has been several days since the last coronavirus test was done and they demanded the release of those who already tested negative. On 20 May 2020, in Concepcion (Concepcion), a group of people demonstrated near a sanitary control checkpoint and in front of the Palace of Justice, to demand their entrance to a property they had been living in. On 18 May 2020, in Emboscada (Cordillera), a group of people, including relatives and the Justice and Social Equality Association, protested to demand clarifications on the case of a girl who disappeared on the previous month. [size=no report]

On 9 May 2020, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), allegedly four EPP (Paraguayan People's Army) members with camouflaged uniforms and hooded faces burned the main house, a bulldozer, two tractors and a pickup truck in Jaguary farm. On 25 January 2018, local inhabitants, together with firefighters, staged a protest in front of the municipality of Alberdi, in Alberdi town (Alberdi, Neembucu), to demand the authorities to mitigate the consequences of the heavy rains, as well as the flooding of the Paraguay river. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Paraguay); FEDECAP: Federation of Truck Drivers from Paraguay

On 25 January 2018, 100 truck drivers affiliated to FEDECAP staged a protest at Km 187 of the Gaspar Rodriguez de Francia - Route 7 road, in the Caaguazu municipality (Caaguazu), against the arrival of ''bitrenes'' trucks (with greater loading capacity). [size=100]
Labour Group (Paraguay); FEDECAP: Federation of Truck Drivers from Paraguay

On 25 January 2018, 50 truck drivers affiliated to FEDECAP staged a protest at Km 63 of the Mariscal Estigarribia - Route 2 road, near Piribebuy, in the Cordillera department, against the arrival of ''bitrenes'' trucks (with greater loading capacity). [size=50]

On 24 January 2018, a group of people staged a protest in front of the Paraguayan Institute for Indigenous Peoples, in Asuncion city (Asuncion, Asuncion), to demand answers by the director regarding the indifference of the Institute before cases of violence against indigenous peoples. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2018, 250 people staged a protest at the intersection between the Mariscal Estigarribia route and the Zavala Cue road, in Fernando de la Mora municipality (Central), to demand the completion of the construction of the metrobus. [size=250]

On 23 January 2018, local inhabitants blocked the Transchaco road, in Villa Hayes city (Villa Hayes, Presidente Hayes), to protest against the lack of potable water supply in the area. [size=no report]

Around 23 January 2018 (as reported), 200 inhabitants from Presidente Franco staged a protest in front the Public Ministry in Ciudad del Este city (Ciudad del Este, Alto Parana) to protest against impunity and demand justice in the case against local authorities Alcides Fernandez and Abraham Alegre, accused of misappropriation of public funds. Protesters blocked the streets near the Public Ministry. [size=200]

On 22 January 2018, 2000 people staged a protest at the entrance to the city of Concepcion (Concepcion, Concepcion) to support the arrival of ''bitrenes'' trucks (with greater loading capacity), claiming that it is an opportunity to boost the local economy. The protest was convened by the Association for Traders and Industrial Workers of Concepcion and the Association for Transportation Workers from the North. [size=2,000]

Around 19 January 2018 (as reported), members of the Ykua Dure religious order staged a protest in front of the Maria Auxiliadora Chapel in Luque city (Luque, Central), to demand priest Richard Noguera to appoint a priest, delegate and deacon so that activities can be resumed in the chapel. [size=no report]

Around 19 January 2018 (as reported), 3 private security guards beat and injured a journalist covering the Carnival celebrations in Encarnacion town (Encarnacion, Itapua). They also destroyed his camera.

On 19 January 2018, relatives of a police officer, allegedly kidnapped by the Army of the Paraguayan Peoples on 4 July 2014, blocked Km 78 of the Gral. Bernardino Caballero - Route 5 road in the Arroyito municipality (Concepcion) to demand information about the whereabouts of Edelio. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2018, inhabitants from Banado Norte blocked the Artigas Avenue in Asuncion city (Asuncion, Asuncion) to demand the authorities to provide them with assistance before the Paraguay river flooding. [size=no report]
Rioters (Paraguay); ANR-PC: National Republican Association - Colorado Party

On 15 January 2018, local inhabitants took to the streets in Asuncion city (Asuncion, Asuncion), marching from the Ministry of Public Works and Communications to the headquarters of the National Republican Association - Colorado Party, to demonstrate against the increase in the price of public transport. Rioters burned tires and threw stones against the police forces, that were present to prevent clashes. As a result, 1 police officer was injured. Members of the ANR-PC that were inside the building threw objects against rioters. [size=no report]

Around 13 January 2018 (as reported), more than 70 local inhabitants took to the streets in San Lorenzo town (San Lorenzo, Central) to protest against the implementation of paying parking spots in the area. [size=70]

On 11 January 2018, the police forces clashed with unidentified armed actors in the Ciudad del Este municipality (Alto Parana). As a result, 3 armed actors were killed. Local neighbours claim that the police officers perpetrated extra-judicial killings, as after the clash the 3 young men got out of the car without attacking them and the police officers still shot them dead. The police forces claim that the 3 young men attacked them and they shot in response. The events are under investigation.
On 9 January 2018, at the municipality of Asuncion workers from the Central Market (Central de Abastos) protested against the raise in rent costos.
On 6 January 2018, a protest lead by locals took place at Barrio Trinidad in Asuncion against the public works / construction taking place in the neighbourhood.
On 5 January 2018, farmers from the Maria Auxiliar neighbourhood at Tavai, protested due to the land conflict they face against a foreign enterprise who's claiming a part of their land.
On 1 January 2018, a protest took place in Paso Yobai led by miner workes.
On 4 January 2018, locals of Puente Kyjha at the Gral, Francisco Caballero Alvarez district demonstrated for the dismissal of the local governor Nestor Ariel Araujo. Rioters barricaded the route 10.

On 3 January 2018, local inhabitants staged a protest in front of the San Lorenzo Municipality headquarters, in San Lorenzo town (San Lorenzo, Central) against the implementation of paying parking spots in the area. [size=no report]
On 3 January 2018, protests continue in Asuncion, led by indigenous groups demanding their provisions.
On 2 January 2018, at San Juan Bautista Paraguay, a protest occurred in favor of the release of a doctor who was detained because he signed a medical order for two Turkish prisoners who escaped.
On 2 January 2018, a protest took place, indigenous group blocked the streets in protest demanding their access to provisions.
